Incident Response Services

Comprehensive incident response capabilities to handle any security emergency

Breach Investigation
Comprehensive analysis to determine the scope, impact, and root cause of security incidents
  • Attack vector analysis
  • Timeline reconstruction
  • Evidence preservation
  • Impact assessment
Digital Forensics
Expert forensic analysis of compromised systems and data to support investigation and legal proceedings
  • Memory analysis
  • Disk imaging
  • Network forensics
  • Mobile device analysis
Recovery Planning
Strategic planning and execution of system recovery and business continuity restoration
  • Recovery prioritization
  • System restoration
  • Data recovery
  • Business continuity
Post-Incident Analysis
Detailed analysis and recommendations to prevent future incidents and improve security posture
  • Lessons learned
  • Security improvements
  • Process updates
  • Training recommendations

Incident Response Process

Structured methodology following NIST guidelines for effective incident management

Phase 1
Detection & Analysis
0-2 hours
Rapid identification and initial assessment of the security incident
Incident validation and classification
Initial containment measures
Stakeholder notification
Evidence preservation
Phase 2
Containment
2-6 hours
Isolation of affected systems to prevent further damage
Short-term containment
System isolation
Threat neutralization
Backup verification
Phase 3
Eradication
6-24 hours
Complete removal of threats from the environment
Malware removal
Vulnerability patching
Account remediation
System hardening
Phase 4
Recovery
1-7 days
Restoration of systems and services to normal operations
System restoration
Service validation
Monitoring enhancement
User access restoration
Phase 5
Lessons Learned
1-2 weeks
Documentation and improvement of incident response processes
Incident documentation
Process improvement
Staff training updates
Prevention strategies

Incident Types We Handle

Expert response to all types of cybersecurity incidents with appropriate urgency levels

Ransomware Attack
Critical
Malicious encryption of data with ransom demands
Response time: < 1 hour
Data Breach
High
Unauthorized access to sensitive information
Response time: < 2 hours
Malware Infection
High
Malicious software compromising systems
Response time: < 2 hours
Insider Threat
Medium
Malicious or negligent actions by internal users
Response time: < 4 hours
DDoS Attack
High
Distributed denial of service affecting availability
Response time: < 1 hour
Supply Chain Compromise
High
Third-party vendor or supplier security incident
Response time: < 2 hours
